summary.long: Acts is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The former account, indeed, I made concerning all things, O Theophilus, that Jesus began both to do and to teach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: till the day in which, having given command, through the Holy Spirit, to the apostles whom he did choose out, he was taken up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom also he did present himself alive after his suffering, in many certain proofs, through forty days being seen by them, and speaking the things concerning the reign of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being assembled together with them, he commanded them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the promise of the Father, which, [saith he,] `Ye did hear of me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because John, indeed, baptized with water, and ye shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit -- after not many days.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They, therefore, indeed, having come together, were questioning him, saying, `Lord, dost thou at this time restore the reign to Israel?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto them, `It is not yours to know times or seasons that the Father did appoint in His own authority;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but ye shall receive power at the coming of the Holy Spirit upon you, and ye shall be witnesses to me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judea, and Samaria, and unto the end of the earth.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these things having said -- they beholding -- he was taken up, and a cloud did receive him up from their sight;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as they were looking stedfastly to the heaven in his going on, then, lo, two men stood by them in white apparel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also said, `Men, Galileans, why do ye stand gazing into the heaven? this Jesus who was received up from you into the heaven, shall so come in what manner ye saw him going on to the heaven.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then did they return to Jerusalem from the mount that is called of Olives, that is near Jerusalem, a sabbath's journey;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they came in, they went up to the upper room, where were abiding both Peter, and James, and John, and Andrew, Philip, and Thomas, Bartholomew, and Matthew, James, of Alphaeus, and Simon the Zelotes, and Judas, of James;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these all were continuing with one accord in prayer and supplication, with women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in these days, Peter having risen up in the midst of the disciples, said, (the multitude also of the names at the same place was, as it were, an hundred and twenty,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Men, brethren, it behoved this Writing that it be fulfilled that beforehand the Holy Spirit spake through the mouth of David, concerning Judas, who became guide to those who took Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was numbered among us, and did receive the share in this ministration,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one, indeed, then, purchased a field out of the reward of unrighteousness, and falling headlong, burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed forth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it became known to all those dwelling in Jerusalem, insomuch that that place is called, in their proper dialect, Aceldama, that is, field of blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it hath been written in the book of Psalms: Let his lodging-place become desolate, and let no one be dwelling in it, and his oversight let another take.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `It behoveth, therefore, of the men who did go with us during all the time in which the Lord Jesus went in and went out among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beginning from the baptism of John, unto the day in which he was received up from us, one of these to become with us a witness of his rising again.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set two, Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having prayed, they said, `Thou, Lord, who art knowing the heart of all, shew which one thou didst choose of these two
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to receive the share of this ministration and apostleship, from which Judas, by transgression, did fall, to go on to his proper place;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they gave their lots, and the lot fell upon Matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the day of the Pentecost being fulfilled, they were all with one accord at the same place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there came suddenly out of the heaven a sound as of a bearing violent breath, and it filled all the house where they were sitting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there appeared to them divided tongues, as it were of fire; it sat also upon each one of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other tongues, according as the Spirit was giving them to declare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men from every nation of those under the heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the rumour of this having come, the multitude came together, and was confounded, because they were each one hearing them speaking in his proper dialect,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were all amazed, and did wonder, saying one unto another, `Lo, are not all these who are speaking Galileans?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how do we hear, each in our proper dialect, in which we were born?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and those dwelling in Mesopotamia, in Judea also, and Cappadocia, Pontus, and Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phrygia also, and Pamphylia, Egypt, and the parts of Libya, that [are] along Cyrene, and the strangers of Rome, both Jews and proselytes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cretes and Arabians, we did hear them speaking in our tongues the great things of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one unto another, `What would this wish to be?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and others mocking said, -- `They are full of sweet wine;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter having stood up with the eleven, lifted up his voice and declared to them, `Men, Jews! and all those dwelling in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and harken to my sayings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for these are not drunken, as ye take it up, for it is the third hour of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But this is that which hath been spoken through the prophet Joel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be in the last days, saith God, I will pour out of My Spirit upon all flesh, and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also upon My men-servants, and upon My maid-servants, in those days, I will pour out of My Spirit, and they shall prophesy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will give wonders in the heaven above, and signs upon the earth beneath -- blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sun shall be turned to darkness, and the moon to blood, before the coming of the day of the Lord -- the great and illustrious;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it shall be, every one -- whoever shall call upon the name of the Lord, he shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Men, Israelites! hear these words, Jesus the Nazarene, a man approved of God among you by mighty works, and wonders, and signs, that God did through him in the midst of you, according as also ye yourselves have known;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one, by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, being given out, having taken by lawless hands, having crucified -- ye did slay;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom God did raise up, having loosed the pains of the death, because it was not possible for him to be held by it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for David saith in regard to him: I foresaw the Lord always before me -- because He is on my right hand -- that I may not be moved;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of this was my heart cheered, and my tongue was glad, and yet -- my flesh also shall rest on hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Thou wilt not leave my soul to hades, nor wilt Thou give Thy Kind One to see corruption;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou didst make known to me ways of life, Thou shalt fill me with joy with Thy countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Men, brethren! it is permitted to speak with freedom unto you concerning the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is among us unto this day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a prophet, therefore, being, and knowing that with an oath God did swear to him, out of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, to raise up the Christ, to sit upon his throne,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having foreseen, he did speak concerning the rising again of the Christ, that his soul was not left to hades, nor did his flesh see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This Jesus did God raise up, of which we are all witnesses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the right hand then of God having been exalted -- also the promise of the Holy Spirit having received from the Father -- he was shedding forth this, which now ye see and hear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for David did not go up to the heavens, and he saith himself: The Lord saith to my lord, Sit thou at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: till I make thy foes thy footstool;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: assuredly, therefore, let all the house of Israel know, that both Lord and Christ did God make him -- this Jesus whom ye did crucify.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having heard, they were pricked to the heart; they say also to Peter, and to the rest of the apostles, `What shall we do, men, brethren?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter said unto them, `Reform, and be baptized each of you on the name of Jesus Christ, to remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for to you is the promise, and to your children, and to all those afar off, as many as the Lord our God shall call.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also with many more other words he was testifying and exhorting, saying, `Be saved from this perverse generation;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then those, indeed, who did gladly receive his word were baptized, and there were added on that day, as it were, three thousand souls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were continuing stedfastly in the teaching of the apostles, and the fellowship, and the breaking of the bread, and the prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear came on every soul, many wonders also and signs were being done through the apostles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all those believing were at the same place, and had all things common,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the possessions and the goods they were selling, and were parting them to all, according as any one had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Daily also continuing with one accord in the temple, breaking also at every house bread, they were partaking of food in gladness and simplicity of heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praising God, and having favour with all the people, and the Lord was adding those being saved every day to the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter and John were going up at the same time to the temple, at the hour of the prayer, the ninth [hour],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a certain man, being lame from the womb of his mother, was being carried, whom they were laying every day at the gate of the temple, called Beautiful, to ask a kindness from those entering into the temple,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, having seen Peter and John about to go into the temple, was begging to receive a kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter, having looked stedfastly toward him with John, said, `Look toward us;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was giving heed to them, looking to receive something from them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter said, `Silver and gold I have none, but what I have, that I give to thee; in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and be walking.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having seized him by the right hand, he raised [him] up, and presently his feet and ankles were strengthened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and springing up, he stood, and was walking, and did enter with them into the temple, walking and springing, and praising God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the people saw him walking and praising God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were knowing him also that this it was who for a kindness was sitting at the Beautiful gate of the temple, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what hath happened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the lame man who was healed holding Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch called Solomon's -- greatly amazed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter having seen, answered unto the people, `Men, Israelites! why wonder ye at this? or on us why look ye so earnestly, as if by our own power or piety we have made him to walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, did glorify His child Jesus, whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, he having given judgment to release [him],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye the Holy and Righteous One did deny, and desired a man -- a murderer -- to be granted to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Prince of the life ye did kill, whom God did raise out of the dead, of which we are witnesses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the faith of his name, this one whom ye see and have known, his name made strong, even the faith that [is] through him did give to him this perfect soundness before you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, brethren, I have known that through ignorance ye did [it], as also your rulers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and God, what things before He had declared through the mouth of all His prophets, that the Christ should suffer, He did thus fulfil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: reform ye, therefore, and turn back, for your sins being blotted out, that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He may send Jesus Christ who before hath been preached to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom it behoveth heaven, indeed, to receive till times of a restitution of all things, of which God spake through the mouth of all His holy prophets from the age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For Moses, indeed, unto the fathers said -- A prophet to you shall the Lord your God raise up out of your brethren, like to me; him shall ye hear in all things, as many as he may speak unto you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it shall be, every soul that may not hear that prophet shall be utterly destroyed out of the people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also all the prophets from Samuel and those following in order, as many as spake, did also foretell of these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye are sons of the prophets, and of the covenant that God made unto our fathers, saying unto Abraham: And in thy seed shall be blessed all the families of the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to you first, God, having raised up His child Jesus, did send him, blessing you, in the turning away of each one from your evil ways.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they are speaking unto the people, there came to them the priests, and the magistrate of the temple, and the Sadducees --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being grieved because of their teaching the people, and preaching in Jesus the rising again out of the dead --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they laid hands upon them, and did put them in custody unto the morrow, for it was evening already;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many of those hearing the word did believe, and the number of the men became, as it were, five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass upon the morrow, there were gathered together of them the rulers, and elders, and scribes, to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Annas the chief priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the chief priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having set them in the midst, they were inquiring, `In what power, or in what name did ye do this?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter, having been filled with the Holy Spirit, said unto them: `Rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if we to-day are examined concerning the good deed to the ailing man, by whom he hath been saved,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be it known to all of you, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye did crucify, whom God did raise out of the dead, in him hath this one stood by before you whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This is the stone that was set at nought by you -- the builders, that became head of a corner;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there is not salvation in any other, for there is no other name under the heaven that hath been given among men, in which it behoveth us to be saved.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And beholding the openness of Peter and John, and having perceived that they are men unlettered and plebeian, they were wondering -- they were taking knowledge also of them that with Jesus they had been --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and seeing the man standing with them who hath been healed, they had nothing to say against [it],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having commanded them to go away out of the sanhedrim, they took counsel with one another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `What shall we do to these men? because that, indeed, a notable sign hath been done through them, to all those dwelling in Jerusalem [is] manifest, and we are not able to deny [it];
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but that it may spread no further toward the people, let us strictly threaten them no more to speak in this name to any man.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having called them, they charged them not to speak at all, nor to teach, in the name of Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter and John answering unto them said, `Whether it is righteous before God to hearken to you rather than to God, judge ye;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we cannot but speak what we did see and hear.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they having further threatened [them], let them go, finding nothing how they may punish them, because of the people, because all were glorifying God for that which hath been done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for above forty years of age was the man upon whom had been done this sign of the healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being let go, they went unto their own friends, and declared whatever the chief priests and the elders said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they having heard, with one accord did lift up the voice unto God, and said, `Lord, thou [art] God, who didst make the heaven, and the earth, and the sea, and all that [are] in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, through the mouth of David thy servant, did say, Why did nations rage, and peoples meditate vain things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the kings of the earth stood up, and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord and against His Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for gathered together of a truth against Thy holy child Jesus, whom Thou didst anoint, were both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with nations and peoples of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to do whatever Thy hand and Thy counsel did determine before to come to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, Lord, look upon their threatenings, and grant to Thy servants with all freedom to speak Thy word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the stretching forth of Thy hand, for healing, and signs, and wonders, to come to pass through the name of Thy holy child Jesus.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they having prayed, the place was shaken in which they were gathered together, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and were speaking the word of God with freedom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of the multitude of those who did believe the heart and the soul was one, and not one was saying that anything of the things he had was his own, but all things were to them in common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with great power were the apostles giving the testimony to the rising again of the Lord Jesus, great grace also was on them all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for there was not any one among them who did lack, for as many as were possessors of fields, or houses, selling [them], were bringing the prices of the thing sold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were laying them at the feet of the apostles, and distribution was being made to each according as any one had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joses, who was surnamed by the apostles Barnabas -- which is, having been interpreted, Son of Comfort -- a Levite, of Cyprus by birth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a field being his, having sold [it], brought the money and laid [it] at the feet of the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain man, Ananias by name, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did keep back of the price -- his wife also knowing -- and having brought a certain part, at the feet of the apostles he laid [it].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, `Ananias, wherefore did the Adversary fill thy heart, for thee to lie to the Holy Spirit, and to keep back of the price of the place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while it remained, did it not remain thine? and having been sold, in thy authority was it not? why [is] it that thou didst put in thy heart this thing? thou didst not lie to men, but to God;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ananias hearing these words, having fallen down, did expire, and great fear came upon all who heard these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having risen, the younger men wound him up, and having carried forth, they buried [him].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, about three hours after, that his wife, not knowing what hath happened, came in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter answered her, `Tell me if for so much ye sold the place;' and she said, `Yes, for so much.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said unto her, `How was it agreed by you, to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? lo, the feet of those who did bury thy husband [are] at the door, and they shall carry thee forth;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she fell down presently at his feet, and expired, and the young men having come in, found her dead, and having carried forth, they buried [her] by her husband;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and great fear came upon all the assembly, and upon all who heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And through the hands of the apostles came many signs and wonders among the people, and they were with one accord all in the porch of Solomon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of the rest no one was daring to join himself to them, but the people were magnifying them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (and the more were believers added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so as into the broad places to bring forth the ailing, and to lay [them] upon couches and mats, that at the coming of Peter, even [his] shadow might overshadow some one of them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there were coming together also the people of the cities round about to Jerusalem, bearing ailing persons, and those harassed by unclean spirits -- who were all healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having risen, the chief priest, and all those with him -- being the sect of the Sadducees -- were filled with zeal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and laid their hands upon the apostles, and did put them in a public prison;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a messenger of the Lord through the night opened the doors of the prison, having also brought them forth, he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Go on, and standing, speak in the temple to the people all the sayings of this life;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having heard, they did enter at the dawn into the temple, and were teaching. And the chief priest having come, and those with him, they called together the sanhedrim and all the senate of the sons of Israel, and they sent to the prison to have them brought,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the officers having come, did not find them in the prison, and having turned back, they told,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying -- `The prison indeed we found shut in all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors, and having opened -- within we found no one.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the priest, and the magistrate of the temple, and the chief priests, heard these words, they were doubting concerning them to what this would come;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and coming near, a certain one told them, saying -- `Lo, the men whom ye did put in the prison are in the temple standing and teaching the people;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the magistrate having gone away with officers, brought them without violence, for they were fearing the people, lest they should be stoned;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having brought them, they set [them] in the sanhedrim, and the chief priest questioned them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `Did not we strictly command you not to teach in this name? and lo, ye have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and ye intend to bring upon us the blood of this man.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter and the apostles answering, said, `To obey God it behoveth, rather than men;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the God of our fathers did raise up Jesus, whom ye slew, having hanged upon a tree;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one God, a Prince and a Saviour, hath exalted with His right hand, to give reformation to Israel, and forgiveness of sins;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we are His witnesses of these sayings, and the Holy Spirit also, whom God gave to those obeying him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they having heard, were cut [to the heart], and were taking counsel to slay them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but a certain one, having risen up in the sanhedrim -- a Pharisee, by name Gamaliel, a teacher of law honoured by all the people -- commanded to put the apostles forth a little,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto them, `Men, Israelites, take heed to yourselves about these men, what ye are about to do,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for before these days rose up Theudas, saying, that himself was some one, to whom a number of men did join themselves, as it were four hundred, who was slain, and all, as many as were obeying him, were scattered, and came to nought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `After this one rose up, Judas the Galilean, in the days of the enrollment, and drew away much people after him, and that one perished, and all, as many as were obeying him, were scattered;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now I say to you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone, because if this counsel or this work may be of men, it will be overthrown,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it be of God, ye are not able to overthrow it, lest perhaps also ye be found fighting against God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to him they agreed, and having called near the apostles, having beaten [them], they commanded [them] not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they, indeed, then, departed from the presence of the sanhedrim, rejoicing that for his name they were counted worthy to suffer dishonour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every day also in the temple, and in every house, they were not ceasing teaching and proclaiming good news -- Jesus the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in these days, the disciples multiplying, there came a murmuring of the Hellenists at the Hebrews, because their widows were being overlooked in the daily ministration,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the twelve, having called near the multitude of the disciples, said, `It is not pleasing that we, having left the word of God, do minister at tables;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: look out, therefore, brethren, seven men of you who are well testified of, full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom, whom we may set over this necessity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we to prayer, and to the ministration of the word, will give ourselves continually.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the thing was pleasing before all the multitude, and they did choose Stephen, a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a proselyte of Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom they did set before the apostles, and they, having prayed, laid on them [their] hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of God did increase, and the number of the disciples did multiply in Jerusalem exceedingly; a great multitude also of the priests were obedient to the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Stephen, full of faith and power, was doing great wonders and signs among the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there arose certain of those of the synagogue, called of the Libertines, and Cyrenians, and Alexandrians, and of those from Cilicia, and Asia, disputing with Stephen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit with which he was speaking;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then they suborned men, saying -- `We have heard him speaking evil sayings in regard to Moses and God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did stir up also the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and having come upon [him], they caught him, and brought [him] to the sanhedrim;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they set up also false witnesses, saying, `This one doth not cease to speak evil sayings against this holy place and the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we have heard him saying, That this Jesus the Nazarean shall overthrow this place, and shall change the customs that Moses delivered to us;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and gazing at him, all those sitting in the sanhedrim saw his face as it were the face of a messenger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priest said, `Are then these things so?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, `Men, brethren, and fathers, hearken: The God of the glory did appear to our father Abraham, being in Mesopotamia, before his dwelling in Haran,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He said to him, Go forth out of thy land, and out of thy kindred, and come to a land that I shall shew thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Then having come forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, he dwelt in Haran, and from thence, after the death of his father, He did remove him to this land wherein ye now dwell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He gave him no inheritance in it, not even a footstep, and did promise to give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him -- he having no child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And God spake thus, That his seed shall be sojourning in a strange land, and they shall cause it to serve, and shall do it evil four hundred years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the nation whom they shall serve I will judge, said God; and after these things they shall come forth and shall do Me service in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And He gave to him a covenant of circumcision, and so he begat Isaac, and did circumcise him on the eighth day, and Isaac [begat] Jacob, and Jacob -- the twelve patriarchs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the patriarchs, having been moved with jealousy, sold Joseph to Egypt, and God was with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did deliver him out of all his tribulations, and gave him favour and wisdom before Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he did set him -- governor over Egypt and all his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And there came a dearth upon all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great tribulation, and our fathers were not finding sustenance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jacob having heard that there was corn in Egypt, sent forth our fathers a first time;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and at the second time was Joseph made known to his brethren, and Joseph's kindred became manifest to Pharaoh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joseph having sent, did call for his father Jacob, and all his kindred -- with seventy and five souls --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jacob went down to Egypt, and died, himself and our fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were carried over into Sychem, and were laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in money from the sons of Emmor, of Sychem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And according as the time of the promise was drawing nigh, which God did swear to Abraham, the people increased and multiplied in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: till another king rose, who had not known Joseph;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one, having dealt subtilely with our kindred, did evil to our fathers, causing to expose their babes, that they might not live;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which time Moses was born, and he was fair to God, and he was brought up three months in the house of his father;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having been exposed, the daughter of Pharaoh took him up, and did rear him to herself for a son;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses was taught in all wisdom of the Egyptians, and he was powerful in words and in works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when forty years were fulfilled to him, it came upon his heart to look after his brethren, the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having seen a certain one suffering injustice, he did defend, and did justice to the oppressed, having smitten the Egyptian;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was supposing his brethren to understand that God through his hand doth give salvation; and they did not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `On the succeeding day, also, he shewed himself to them as they are striving, and urged them to peace, saying, Men, brethren are ye, wherefore do ye injustice to one another?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who is doing injustice to the neighbour, did thrust him away, saying, Who set thee a ruler and a judge over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to kill me dost thou wish, as thou didst kill yesterday the Egyptian?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Moses fled at this word, and became a sojourner in the land of Midian, where he begat two sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and forty years having been fulfilled, there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sinai a messenger of the Lord, in a flame of fire of a bush,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses having seen did wonder at the sight; and he drawing near to behold, there came a voice of the Lord unto him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I [am] the God of thy fathers; the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. `And Moses having become terrified, durst not behold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord said to him, Loose the sandal of thy feet, for the place in which thou hast stood is holy ground;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seeing I have seen the affliction of My people that [is] in Egypt, and their groaning I did hear, and came down to deliver them; and now come, I will send thee to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This Moses, whom they did refuse, saying, Who did set thee a ruler and a judge? this one God a ruler and a redeemer did send, in the hand of a messenger who appeared to him in the bush;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one did bring them forth, having done wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness forty years;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this is the Moses who did say to the sons of Israel: A prophet to you shall the Lord your God raise up out of your brethren, like to me, him shall ye hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This is he who was in the assembly in the wilderness, with the messenger who is speaking to him in the mount Sinai, and with our fathers who did receive the living oracles to give to us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom our fathers did not wish to become obedient, but did thrust away, and turned back in their hearts to Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to Aaron, Make to us gods who shall go on before us, for this Moses, who brought us forth out of the land of Egypt, we have not known what hath happened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And they made a calf in those days, and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and were rejoicing in the works of their hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and God did turn, and did give them up to do service to the host of the heaven, according as it hath been written in the scroll of the prophets: Slain beasts and sacrifices did ye offer to Me forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch, and the star of your god Remphan -- the figures that ye made to bow before them, and I will remove your dwelling beyond Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The tabernacle of the testimony was among our fathers in the wilderness, according as He did direct, who is speaking to Moses, to make it according to the figure that he had seen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which also our fathers having in succession received, did bring in with Joshua, into the possession of the nations whom God did drive out from the presence of our fathers, till the days of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who found favour before God, and requested to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Solomon built Him an house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But the Most High in sanctuaries made with hands doth not dwell, according as the prophet saith:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heaven [is] My throne, and the earth My footstool; what house will ye build to Me? saith the Lord, or what [is] the place of My rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: hath not My hand made all these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and in ears! ye do always the Holy Spirit resist; as your fathers -- also ye;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which of the prophets did not your fathers persecute? and they killed those who declared before about the coming of the Righteous One, of whom now ye betrayers and murderers have become,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who received the law by arrangement of messengers, and did not keep [it].'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hearing these things, they were cut to the hearts, and did gnash the teeth at him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and being full of the Holy Spirit, having looked stedfastly to the heaven, he saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, `Lo, I see the heavens having been opened, and the Son of Man standing on the right hand of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they, having cried out with a loud voice, stopped their ears, and did rush with one accord upon him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having cast him forth outside of the city, they were stoning [him] -- and the witnesses did put down their garments at the feet of a young man called Saul --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were stoning Stephen, calling and saying, `Lord Jesus, receive my spirit;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having bowed the knees, he cried with a loud voice, `Lord, mayest thou not lay to them this sin;' and this having said, he fell asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul was assenting to his death, and there came in that day a great persecution upon the assembly in Jerusalem, all also were scattered abroad in the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and devout men carried away Stephen, and made great lamentation over him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Saul was making havoc of the assembly, into every house entering, and haling men and women, was giving them up to prison;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they then indeed, having been scattered, went abroad proclaiming good news -- the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Philip having gone down to a city of Samaria, was preaching to them the Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the multitudes also were giving heed to the things spoken by Philip, with one accord, in their hearing and seeing the signs that he was doing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for unclean spirits came forth from many who were possessed, crying with a loud voice, and many who have been paralytic and lame were healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there was great joy in that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain man, by name Simon, was before in the city using magic, and amazing the nation of Samaria, saying himself to be a certain great one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom they were all giving heed, from small unto great, saying, `This one is the great power of God;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were giving heed to him, because of his having for a long time amazed them with deeds of magic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they believed Philip, proclaiming good news, the things concerning the reign of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized both men and women;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Simon also himself did believe, and, having been baptized, he was continuing with Philip, beholding also signs and mighty acts being done, he was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles in Jerusalem having heard that Samaria hath received the word of God, did send unto them Peter and John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who having come down did pray concerning them, that they may receive the Holy Spirit, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for as yet he was fallen upon none of them, and only they have been baptized -- to the name of the Lord Jesus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then were they laying hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon, having beheld that through the laying on of the hands of the apostles, the Holy Spirit is given, brought before them money,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `Give also to me this authority, that on whomsoever I may lay the hands, he may receive the Holy Spirit.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said unto him, `Thy silver with thee -- may it be to destruction! because the gift of God thou didst think to possess through money;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou hast neither part nor lot in this thing, for thy heart is not right before God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: reform, therefore, from this thy wickedness, and beseech God, if then the purpose of thy heart may be forgiven thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in the gall of bitterness, and bond of unrighteousness, I perceive thee being.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon answering, said, `Beseech ye for me unto the Lord, that nothing may come upon me of the things ye have spoken.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They indeed, therefore, having testified fully, and spoken the word of the Lord, did turn back to Jerusalem; in many villages also of the Samaritans they did proclaim good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a messenger of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, `Arise, and go on toward the south, on the way that is going down from Jerusalem to Gaza,' -- this is desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having arisen, he went on, and lo, a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch, a man of rank, of Candace the queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to worship to Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he was also returning, and is sitting on his chariot, and he was reading the prophet Isaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Spirit said to Philip, `Go near, and be joined to this chariot;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Philip having run near, heard him reading the prophet Isaiah, and said, `Dost thou then know what thou dost read?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, `Why, how am I able, if some one may not guide me?' he called Philip also, having come up, to sit with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the contents of the Writing that he was reading was this: `As a sheep unto slaughter he was led, and as a lamb before his shearer dumb, so he doth not open his mouth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in his humiliation his judgment was taken away, and his generation -- who shall declare? because taken from the earth is his life.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the eunuch answering Philip said, `I pray thee, about whom doth the prophet say this? about himself, or about some other one?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Philip having opened his mouth, and having begun from this Writing, proclaimed good news to him -- Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were going on the way, they came upon a certain water, and the eunuch said, `Lo, water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [And Philip said, `If thou dost believe out of all the heart, it is lawful;' and he answering said, `I believe Jesus Christ to be the Son of God;']
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he commanded the chariot to stand still, and they both went down to the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, and the eunuch saw him no more, for he was going on his way rejoicing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Philip was found at Azotus, and passing through, he was proclaiming good news to all the cities, till his coming to Cesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul, yet breathing of threatening and slaughter to the disciples of the Lord, having gone to the chief priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: did ask from him letters to Damascus, unto the synagogues, that if he may find any being of the way, both men and women, he may bring them bound to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the going, he came nigh to Damascus, and suddenly there shone round about him a light from the heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having fallen upon the earth, he heard a voice saying to him, `Saul, Saul, why me dost thou persecute?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, `Who art thou, Lord?' and the Lord said, `I am Jesus whom thou dost persecute; hard for thee at the pricks to kick;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: trembling also, and astonished, he said, `Lord, what dost thou wish me to do?' and the Lord [said] unto him, `Arise, and enter into the city, and it shall be told thee what it behoveth thee to do.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men who are journeying with him stood speechless, hearing indeed the voice but seeing no one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Saul arose from the earth, and his eyes having been opened, he beheld no one, and leading him by the hand they brought him to Damascus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was three days without seeing, and he did neither eat nor drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a certain disciple in Damascus, by name Ananias, and the Lord said unto him in a vision, `Ananias;' and he said, `Behold me, Lord;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord [saith] unto him, `Having risen, go on unto the street that is called Straight, and seek in the house of Judas, [one] by name Saul of Tarsus, for, lo, he doth pray,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saw in a vision a man, by name Ananias, coming in, and putting a hand on him, that he may see again.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ananias answered, `Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how many evils he did to Thy saints in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and here he hath authority from the chief priests, to bind all those calling on Thy name.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto him, `Be going on, because a choice vessel to Me is this one, to bear My name before nations and kings -- the sons also of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will shew him how many things it behoveth him for My name to suffer.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ananias went away, and did enter into the house, and having put upon him [his] hands, said, `Saul, brother, the Lord hath sent me -- Jesus who did appear to thee in the way in which thou wast coming -- that thou mayest see again, and mayest be filled with the Holy Spirit.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it were scales, he saw again also presently, and having risen, was baptized,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having received nourishment, was strengthened, and Saul was with the disciples in Damascus certain days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and immediately in the synagogues he was preaching the Christ, that he is the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all those hearing were amazed, and said, `Is not this he who laid waist in Jerusalem those calling on this name, and hither to this intent had come, that he might bring them bound to the chief priests?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul was still more strengthened, and he was confounding the Jews dwelling in Damascus, proving that this is the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel together to kill him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their counsel against [him] was known to Saul; they were also watching the gates both day and night, that they may kill him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the disciples having taken him, by night did let him down by the wall, letting down in a basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul, having come to Jerusalem, did try to join himself to the disciples, and they were all afraid of him, not believing that he is a disciple,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Barnabas having taken him, brought [him] unto the apostles, and did declare to them how in the way he saw the Lord, and that he spake to him, and how in Damascus he was speaking boldly in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was with them, coming in and going out in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and speaking boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, he was both speaking and disputing with the Hellenists, and they were taking in hand to kill him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the brethren having known, brought him down to Cesarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, indeed, the assemblies throughout all Judea, and Galilee, and Samaria, had peace, being built up, and, going on in the fear of the Lord, and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, they were multiplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass that Peter passing throughout all [quarters], came down also unto the saints who were dwelling at Lydda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he found there a certain man, Aeneas by name -- for eight years laid upon a couch -- who was paralytic,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter said to him, `Aeneas, heal thee doth Jesus the Christ; arise and spread for thyself;' and immediately he rose,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all those dwelling at Lydda, and Saron saw him, and did turn to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in Joppa there was a certain female disciple, by name Tabitha, (which interpreted, is called Dorcas,) this woman was full of good works and kind acts that she was doing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it came to pass in those days she, having ailed, died, and having bathed her, they laid her in an upper chamber,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Lydda being nigh to Joppa, the disciples having heard that Peter is in that [place], sent two men unto him, calling on him not to delay to come through unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter having risen, went with them, whom having come, they brought into the upper chamber, and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing coats and garments, as many as Dorcas was making while she was with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter having put them all forth without, having bowed the knees, did pray, and having turned unto the body said, `Tabitha, arise;' and she opened her eyes, and having seen Peter, she sat up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having given her [his] hand, he lifted her up, and having called the saints and the widows, he presented her alive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed on the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it came to pass, that he remained many days in Joppa, with a certain one, Simon a tanner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a certain man in Cesarea, by name Cornelius, a centurion from a band called Italian,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: pious, and fearing God with all his house, doing also many kind acts to the people, and beseeching God always,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he saw in a vision manifestly, as it were the ninth hour of the day, a messenger of God coming in unto him, and saying to him, `Cornelius;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having looked earnestly on him, and becoming afraid, said, `What is it, Lord?' And he said to him, `Thy prayers and thy kind acts came up for a memorial before God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now send men to Joppa, and send for a certain one Simon, who is surnamed Peter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one doth lodge with a certain Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea; this one shall speak to thee what it behoveth thee to do.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the messenger who is speaking to Cornelius went away, having called two of his domestics, and a pious soldier of those waiting on him continually,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having declared to them all things, he sent them to Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the morrow, as these are proceeding on the way, and are drawing nigh to the city, Peter went up upon the house-top to pray, about the sixth hour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he became very hungry, and wished to eat; and they making ready, there fell upon him a trance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he doth behold the heaven opened, and descending unto him a certain vessel, as a great sheet, bound at the four corners, and let down upon the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which were all the four-footed beasts of the earth, and the wild beasts, and the creeping things, and the fowls of the heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there came a voice unto him: `Having risen, Peter, slay and eat.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, `Not so, Lord; because at no time did I eat anything common or unclean;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and [there is] a voice again a second time unto him: `What God did cleanse, thou, declare not thou common;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this was done thrice, and again was the vessel received up to the heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Peter was perplexed in himself what the vision that he saw might be, then, lo, the men who have been sent from Cornelius, having made inquiry for the house of Simon, stood at the gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having called, they were asking if Simon, who is surnamed Peter, doth lodge here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter thinking about the vision, the Spirit said to him, `Lo, three men do seek thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but having risen, go down and go on with them, nothing doubting, because I have sent them;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter having come down unto the men who have been sent from Cornelius unto him, said, `Lo, I am he whom ye seek, what [is] the cause for which ye are present?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, `Cornelius, a centurion, a man righteous and fearing God, well testified to, also, by all the nation of the Jews, was divinely warned by a holy messenger to send for thee, to his house, and to hear sayings from thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having called them in, therefore, he lodged them, and on the morrow Peter went forth with them, and certain of the brethren from Joppa went with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the morrow they did enter into Cesarea; and Cornelius was waiting for them, having called together his kindred and near friends,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as it came that Peter entered in, Cornelius having met him, having fallen at [his] feet, did bow before [him];
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter raised him, saying, `Stand up; I also myself am a man;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and talking with him he went in, and doth find many having come together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `Ye know how it is unlawful for a man, a Jew, to keep company with, or to come unto, one of another race, but to me God did shew to call no man common or unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore also without gainsaying I came, having been sent for; I ask, therefore, for what matter ye did send for me?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Cornelius said, `Four days ago till this hour, I was fasting, and [at] the ninth hour praying in my house, and, lo, a man stood before me in bright clothing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, Cornelius, thy prayer was heard, and thy kind acts were remembered before God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: send, therefore, to Joppa, and call for Simon, who is surnamed Peter; this one doth lodge in the house of Simon a tanner, by the sea, who having come, shall speak to thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at once, therefore, I sent to thee; thou also didst do well, having come; now, therefore, are we all before God present to hear all things that have been commanded thee by God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter having opened his mouth, said, `Of a truth, I perceive that God is no respecter of persons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in every nation he who is fearing Him, and is working righteousness, is acceptable to Him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the word that he sent to the sons of Israel, proclaiming good news -- peace through Jesus Christ (this one is Lord of all,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye -- ye have known; -- the word that came throughout all Judea, having begun from Galilee, after the baptism that John preached;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus who [is] from Nazareth -- how God did anoint him with the Holy Spirit and power; who went through, doing good, and healing all those oppressed by the devil, because God was with him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we -- we are witnesses of all things that he did, both in the country of the Jews, and in Jerusalem, -- whom they did slay, having hanged upon a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This one God did raise up the third day, and gave him to become manifest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not to all the people, but to witnesses, to those having been chosen before by God -- to us who did eat with [him], and did drink with him, after his rising out of the dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he commanded us to preach to the people, and to testify fully that it is he who hath been ordained by God judge of living and dead --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to this one do all the prophets testify, that through his name every one that is believing in him doth receive remission of sins.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter is yet speaking these sayings, the Holy spirit fell upon all those hearing the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those of the circumcision believing were astonished -- as many as came with Peter -- because also upon the nations the gift of the Holy Spirit hath been poured out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they were hearing them speaking with tongues and magnifying God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Peter, `The water is any one able to forbid, that these may not be baptized, who the Holy Spirit did receive -- even as also we?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he commanded them also to be baptized in the name of the Lord; then they besought him to remain certain days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles and the brethren who are in Judea heard that also the nations did receive the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when Peter came up to Jerusalem, those of the circumcision were contending with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying -- `Unto men uncircumcised thou didst go in, and didst eat with them!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter having begun, did expound to them in order saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `I was in the city of Joppa praying, and I saw in a trance a vision, a certain vessel coming down, as a great sheet by four corners being let down out of the heaven, and it came unto me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at which having looked stedfastly, I was considering, and I saw the four-footed beasts of the earth, and the wild beasts, and the creeping things, and the fowls of heaven;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I heard a voice saying to me, Having risen, Peter, slay and eat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I said, Not so, Lord; because anything common or unclean hath at no time entered into my mouth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a voice did answer me a second time out of the heaven, What God did cleanse, thou -- declare not thou common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this happened thrice, and again was all drawn up to the heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, lo, immediately, three men stood at the house in which I was, having been sent from Cesarea unto me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Spirit said to me to go with them, nothing doubting, and these six brethren also went with me, and we did enter into the house of the man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he declared also to us how he saw the messenger in his house standing, and saying to him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, who is surnamed Peter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shall speak sayings by which thou shalt be saved, thou and all thy house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And in my beginning to speak, the Holy Spirit did fall upon them, even as also upon us in the beginning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I remembered the saying of the Lord, how he said, John indeed did baptize with water, and ye shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if then the equal gift God did give to them as also to us, having believed upon the Lord Jesus Christ, I -- how was I able to withstand God?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they, having heard these things, were silent, and were glorifying God, saying, `Then, indeed, also to the nations did God give the reformation to life.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those, indeed, therefore, having been scattered abroad, from the tribulation that came after Stephen, went through unto Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to none except to Jews only;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there were certain of them men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who having entered into Antioch, were speaking unto the Hellenists, proclaiming good news -- the Lord Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the hand of the Lord was with them, a great number also, having believed, did turn unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the account was heard in the ears of the assembly that [is] in Jerusalem concerning them, and they sent forth Barnabas to go through unto Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, having come, and having seen the grace of God, was glad, and was exhorting all with purpose of heart to cleave to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was a good man, and full of the Holy Spirit, and of faith, and a great multitude was added to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Barnabas went forth to Tarsus, to seek for Saul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having found him, he brought him to Antioch, and it came to pass that they a whole year did assemble together in the assembly, and taught a great multitude, the disciples also were divinely called first in Antioch Christians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in those days there came from Jerusalem prophets to Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one of them, by name Agabus, having stood up, did signify through the Spirit a great dearth is about to be throughout all the world -- which also came to pass in the time of Claudius Caesar --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the disciples, according as any one was prospering, determined each of them to send for ministration to the brethren dwelling in Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which also they did, having sent unto the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about that time, Herod the king put forth his hands, to do evil to certain of those of the assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he killed James, the brother of John, with the sword,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having seen that it is pleasing to the Jews, he added to lay hold of Peter also -- and they were the days of the unleavened food --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom also having seized, he did put in prison, having delivered [him] to four quaternions of soldiers to guard him, intending after the passover to bring him forth to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, therefore, indeed, was kept in the prison, and fervent prayer was being made by the assembly unto God for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when Herod was about to bring him forth, the same night was Peter sleeping between two soldiers, having been bound with two chains, guards also before the door were keeping the prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, a messenger of the Lord stood by, and a light shone in the buildings, and having smitten Peter on the side, he raised him up, saying, `Rise in haste,' and his chains fell from off [his] hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The messenger also said to him, `Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals;' and he did so; and he saith to him, `Put thy garment round and be following me;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having gone forth, he was following him, and he knew not that it is true that which is done through the messenger, and was thinking he saw a vision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having passed through a first ward, and a second, they came unto the iron gate that is leading to the city, which of its own accord did open to them, and having gone forth, they went on through one street, and immediately the messenger departed from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter having come to himself, said, `Now I have known of a truth that the Lord did sent forth His messenger, and did deliver me out of the hand of Herod, and all the expectation of the people of the Jews;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also, having considered, he came unto the house of Mary, the mother of John, who is surnamed Mark, where there were many thronged together and praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter having knocked at the door of the porch, there came a damsel to hearken, by name Rhoda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having known the voice of Peter, from the joy she did not open the porch, but having run in, told of the standing of Peter before the porch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said unto her, `Thou art mad;' and she was confidently affirming [it] to be so, and they said, `It is his messenger;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter was continuing knocking, and having opened, they saw him, and were astonished,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having beckoned to them with the hand to be silent, he declared to them how the Lord brought him out of the prison, and he said, `Declare to James and to the brethren these things;' and having gone forth, he went on to another place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And day having come, there was not a little stir among the soldiers what then was become of Peter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Herod having sought for him, and not having found, having examined the guards, did command [them] to be led away to punishment, and having gone down from Judea to Cesarea, he was abiding [there].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod was highly displeased with the Tyrians and Sidonians, and with one accord they came unto him, and having made a friend of Blastus, who [is] over the bed-chambers of the king, they were asking peace, because of their country being nourished from the king's;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on a set day, Herod having arrayed himself in kingly apparel, and having sat down upon the tribunal, was making an oration unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the populace were shouting, `The voice of a god, and not of a man;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and presently there smote him a messenger of the Lord, because he did not give the glory to God, and having been eaten of worms, he expired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of God did grow and did multiply,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Barnabas and Saul did turn back out of Jerusalem, having fulfilled the ministration, having taken also with [them] John, who was surnamed Mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were certain in Antioch, in the assembly there, prophets and teachers; both Barnabas, and Simeon who is called Niger, and Lucius the Cyrenian, Manaen also -- Herod the tetrarch's foster-brother -- and Saul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in their ministering to the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, `Separate ye to me both Barnabas and Saul to the work to which I have called them,'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then having fasted, and having prayed, and having laid the hands on them, they sent [them] away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These, indeed, then, having been sent forth by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia, thence also they sailed to Cyprus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come unto Salamis, they declared the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews, and they had also John [as] a ministrant;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having gone through the island unto Paphos, they found a certain magian, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name [is] Bar-Jesus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was with the proconsul Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man; this one having called for Barnabas and Saul, did desire to hear the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there withstood them Elymas the magian -- for so is his name interpreted -- seeking to pervert the proconsul from the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul -- who also [is] Paul -- having been filled with the Holy Spirit, and having looked stedfastly on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: said, `O full of all guile, and all profligacy, son of a devil, enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease perverting the right ways of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, lo, a hand of the Lord [is] upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season;' and presently there fell upon him a mist and darkness, and he, going about, was seeking some to lead [him] by the hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the proconsul having seen what hath come to pass, did believe, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those about Paul having set sail from Paphos, came to Perga of Pamphylia, and John having departed from them, did turn back to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they having gone through from Perga, came to Antioch of Pisidia, and having gone into the synagogue on the sabbath-day, they sat down,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after the reading of the law and of the prophets, the chief men of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, `Men, brethren, if there be a word in you of exhortation unto the people -- say on.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul having risen, and having beckoned with the hand, said, `Men, Israelites, and those fearing God, hearken:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the God of this people Israel did choose our fathers, and the people He did exalt in their sojourning in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm did He bring them out of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and about a period of forty years He did suffer their manners in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, He did divide by lot to them their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And after these things, about four hundred and fifty years, He gave judges -- till Samuel the prophet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thereafter they asked for a king, and God did give to them Saul, son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having removed him, He did raise up to them David for king, to whom also having testified, he said, I found David, the [son] of Jesse, a man according to My heart, who shall do all My will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Of this one's seed God, according to promise, did raise to Israel a Saviour -- Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John having first preached, before his coming, a baptism of reformation to all the people of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as John was fulfilling the course, he said, Whom me do ye suppose to be? I am not [he], but, lo, he doth come after me, of whom I am not worthy to loose the sandal of [his] feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Men, brethren, sons of the race of Abraham, and those among you fearing God, to you was the word of this salvation sent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for those dwelling in Jerusalem, and their chiefs, this one not having known, also the voices of the prophets, which every sabbath are being read -- having judged [him] -- did fulfill,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and no cause of death having found, they did ask of Pilate that he should be slain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they did complete all the things written about him, having taken [him] down from the tree, they laid him in a tomb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and God did raise him out of the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was seen for many days of those who did come up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And we to you do proclaim good news -- that the promise made unto the fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God hath in full completed this to us their children, having raised up Jesus, as also in the second Psalm it hath been written, My Son thou art -- I to-day have begotten thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator
