verses.text: `And that He did raise him up out of the dead, no more to return to corruption, he hath said thus -- I will give to you the faithful kindnesses of David;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherefore also in another [place] he saith, Thou shalt not give Thy kind One to see corruption,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for David, indeed, his own generation having served by the will of God, did fall asleep, and was added unto his fathers, and saw corruption,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he whom God did raise up, did not see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Let it therefore be known to you, men, brethren, that through this one to you is the forgiveness of sins declared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from all things from which ye were not able in the law of Moses to be declared righteous, in this one every one who is believing is declared righteous;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: see, therefore, it may not come upon you that hath been spoken in the prophets:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish, because a work I -- I do work in your days, a work in which ye may not believe, though any one may declare [it] to you.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having gone forth out of the synagogue of the Jews, the nations were calling upon [them] that on the next sabbath these sayings may be spoken to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the synagogue having been dismissed, many of the Jews and of the devout proselytes did follow Paul and Barnabas, who, speaking to them, were persuading them to remain in the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the coming sabbath, almost all the city was gathered together to hear the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Jews having seen the multitudes, were filled with zeal, and did contradict the things spoken by Paul -- contradicting and speaking evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And speaking boldly, Paul and Barnabas said, `To you it was necessary that first the word of God be spoken, and seeing ye do thrust it away, and do not judge yourselves worthy of the life age-during, lo, we do turn to the nations;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for so hath the Lord commanded us: I have set thee for a light of nations -- for thy being for salvation unto the end of the earth.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the nations hearing were glad, and were glorifying the word of the Lord, and did believe -- as many as were appointed to life age-during;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the word of the Lord was spread abroad through all the region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the first men of the city, and did raise persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and did put them out from their borders;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they having shaken off the dust of their feet against them, came to Iconium,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the disciples were filled with joy and the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in Iconium, that they did enter together into the synagogue of the Jews, and spake, so that there believed both of Jews and Greeks a great multitude;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the unbelieving Jews did stir up and made evil the souls of the nations against the brethren;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: long time, indeed, therefore, did they abide speaking boldly in the Lord, who is testifying to the word of His grace, and granting signs and wonders to come to pass through their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude of the city was divided, and some were with the Jews, and some with the apostles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when there was a purpose both of the nations and of the Jews with their rulers to use [them] despitefully, and to stone them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they having become aware, did flee to the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra, and Derbe, and to the region round about,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there they were proclaiming good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain man in Lystra, impotent in the feet, was sitting, being lame from the womb of his mother -- who never had walked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one was hearing Paul speaking, who, having stedfastly beheld him, and having seen that he hath faith to be saved,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: said with a loud voice, `Stand up on thy feet upright;' and he was springing and walking,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the multitudes having seen what Paul did, did lift up their voice, in the speech of Lycaonia, saying, `The gods, having become like men, did come down unto us;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were calling also Barnabas Zeus, and Paul Hermes, since he was the leader in speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest of the Zeus that is before their city, oxen and garlands unto the porches having brought, with the multitudes did wish to sacrifice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having heard, the apostles Barnabas and Paul, having rent their garments, did spring into the multitude, crying
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, `Men, why these things do ye? and we are men like-affected with you, proclaiming good news to you, from these vanities to turn unto the living God, who made the heaven, and the earth, and the sea, and all the things in them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who in the past generations did suffer all the nations to go on in their ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: though, indeed, without witness He did not leave himself, doing good -- from heaven giving rains to us, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and these things saying, scarcely did they restrain the multitudes from sacrificing to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came thither, from Antioch and Iconium, Jews, and they having persuaded the multitudes, and having stoned Paul, drew him outside of the city, having supposed him to be dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the disciples having surrounded him, having risen he entered into the city, and on the morrow he went forth with Barnabas to Derbe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having proclaimed good news also to that city, and having discipled many, they turned back to Lystra, and Iconium, and Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: confirming the souls of the disciples, exhorting to remain in the faith, and that through many tribulations it behoveth us to enter into the reign of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having appointed to them by vote elders in every assembly, having prayed with fastings, they commended them to the Lord in whom they had believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having passed through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having spoken in Perga the word, they went down to Attalia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thence did sail to Antioch, whence they had been given by the grace of God for the work that they fulfilled;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come and gathered together the assembly, they declared as many things as God did with them, and that He did open to the nations a door of faith;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they abode there not a little time with the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain having come down from Judea, were teaching the brethren -- `If ye be not circumcised after the custom of Moses, ye are not able to be saved;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: there having been, therefore, not a little dissension and disputation to Paul and Barnabas with them, they arranged for Paul and Barnabas, and certain others of them, to go up unto the apostles and elders to Jerusalem about this question,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they indeed, then, having been sent forward by the assembly, were passing through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the nations, and they were causing great joy to all the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having come to Jerusalem, they were received by the assembly, and the apostles, and the elders, they declared also as many things as God did with them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there rose up certain of those of the sect of the Pharisees who believed, saying -- `It behoveth to circumcise them, to command them also to keep the law of Moses.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were gathered together the apostles and the elders, to see about this matter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there having been much disputing, Peter having risen up said unto them, `Men, brethren, ye know that from former days, God among us did make choice, through my mouth, for the nations to hear the word of the good news, and to believe;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the heart-knowing God did bare them testimony, having given to them the Holy Spirit, even as also to us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did put no difference also between us and them, by the faith having purified their hearts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now, therefore, why do ye tempt God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, we believe to be saved, even as also they.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the multitude did keep silence, and were hearkening to Barnabas and Paul, declaring as many signs and wonders as God did among the nations through them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after they are silent, James answered, saying, `Men, brethren, hearken to me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon did declare how at first God did look after to take out of the nations a people for His name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to this agree the words of the prophets, as it hath been written:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things I will turn back, and I will build again the tabernacle of David, that is fallen down, and its ruins I will build again, and will set it upright --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the residue of men may seek after the Lord, and all the nations, upon whom My name hath been called, saith the Lord, who is doing all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Known from the ages to God are all His works;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherefore I judge: not to trouble those who from the nations do turn back to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to write to them to abstain from the pollutions of the idols, and the whoredom, and the strangled thing; and the blood;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Moses from former generations in every city hath those preaching him -- in the synagogues every sabbath being read.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole assembly, chosen men out of themselves to send to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas -- Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, leading men among the brethren --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having written through their hand thus: `The apostles, and the elders, and the brethren, to those in Antioch, and Syria, and Cilicia, brethren, who [are] of the nations, greeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seeing we have heard that certain having gone forth from us did trouble you with words, subverting your souls, saying to be circumcised and to keep the law, to whom we did give no charge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed good to us, having come together with one accord, chosen men to send unto you, with our beloved Barnabas and Paul --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men who have given up their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we have sent, therefore, Judas and Silas, and they by word are telling the same things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit, and to us, no more burden to lay upon you, except these necessary things:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to abstain from things offered to idols, and blood, and a strangled thing, and whoredom; from which keeping yourselves, ye shall do well; be strong!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They then, indeed, having been let go, went to Antioch, and having brought the multitude together, did deliver the epistle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they having read, did rejoice for the consolation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas also and Silas, being themselves also prophets, through much discourse did exhort the brethren, and confirm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having passed some time, they were let go with peace from the brethren unto the apostles;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it seemed good to Silas to remain there still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and proclaiming good news -- with many others also -- the word of the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after certain days, Paul said unto Barnabas, `Having turned back again, we may look after our brethren, in every city in which we have preached the word of the Lord -- how they are.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Barnabas counseled to take with [them] John called Mark,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul was not thinking it good to take him with them who withdrew from them from Pamphylia, and did not go with them to the work;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: there came, therefore, a sharp contention, so that they were parted from one another, and Barnabas having taken Mark, did sail to Cyprus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul having chosen Silas, went forth, having been given up to the grace of God by the brethren;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the assemblies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to Derbe and Lystra, and lo, a certain disciple was there, by name Timotheus son of a certain woman, a believing Jewess, but of a father, a Greek,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was well testified to by the brethren in Lystra and Iconium;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one did Paul wish to go forth with him, and having taken [him], he circumcised him, because of the Jews who are in those places, for they all knew his father -- that he was a Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were going on through the cities, they were delivering to them the decrees to keep, that have been judged by the apostles and the elders who [are] in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then, indeed, were the assemblies established in the faith, and were abounding in number every day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having gone through Phrygia and the region of Galatia, having been forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having gone toward Mysia, they were trying to go on toward Bithynia, and the Spirit did not suffer them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having passed by Mysia, they came down to Troas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a vision through the night appeared to Paul -- a certain man of Macedonia was standing, calling upon him, and saying, `Having passed through to Macedonia, help us;' --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he saw the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go forth to Macedonia, assuredly gathering that the Lord hath called us to preach good news to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having set sail, therefore, from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, on the morrow also to Neapolis,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thence also to Philippi, which is a principal city of the part of Macedonia -- a colony. And we were in this city abiding certain days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the sabbath-day also we went forth outside of the city, by a river, where there used to be prayer, and having sat down, we were speaking to the women who came together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a certain woman, by name Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, worshipping God, was hearing, whose heart the Lord did open to attend to the things spoken by Paul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when she was baptized, and her household, she did call upon us, saying, `If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, having entered into my house, remain;' and she constrained us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in our going on to prayer, a certain maid, having a spirit of Python, did meet us, who brought much employment to her masters by soothsaying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: she having followed Paul and us, was crying, saying, `These men are servants of the Most High God, who declare to us a way of salvation;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this she was doing for many days, but Paul having been grieved, and having turned, said to the spirit, `I command thee, in the name of Jesus Christ, to come forth from her;' and it came forth the same hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her masters having seen that the hope of their employment was gone, having caught Paul and Silas, drew [them] to the market-place, unto the rulers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having brought them to the magistrates, they said, `These men do exceedingly trouble our city, being Jews;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they proclaim customs that are not lawful for us to receive nor to do, being Romans.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude rose up together against them, and the magistrates having torn their garments from them, were commanding to beat [them] with rods,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: many blows also having laid upon them, they cast them to prison, having given charge to the jailor to keep them safely,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who such a charge having received, did put them to the inner prison, and their feet made fast in the stocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at midnight Paul and Silas praying, were singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were hearing them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and suddenly a great earthquake came, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken, opened also presently were all the doors, and of all -- the bands were loosed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the jailor having come out of sleep, and having seen the doors of the prison open, having drawn a sword, was about to kill himself, supposing the prisoners to be fled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul cried out with a loud voice, saying, `Thou mayest not do thyself any harm, for we are all here.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, having asked for a light, he sprang in, and trembling he fell down before Paul and Silas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having brought them forth, said, `Sirs, what must I do -- that I may be saved?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said, `Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved -- thou and thy house;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they spake to him the word of the Lord, and to all those in his household;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having taken them, in that hour of the night, he did bathe [them] from the blows, and was baptized, himself and all his presently,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having brought them also into his house, he set food before [them], and was glad with all the household, he having believed in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And day having come, the magistrates sent the rod-bearers, saying, `Let those men go;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the jailor told these words unto Paul -- `The magistrates have sent, that ye may be let go; now, therefore, having gone forth go on in peace;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul said to them, `Having beaten us publicly uncondemned -- men, Romans being -- they did cast [us] to prison, and now privately do they cast us forth! why no! but having come themselves, let them bring us forth.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rod-bearers told to the magistrates these sayings, and they were afraid, having heard that they are Romans,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come, they besought them, and having brought [them] forth, they were asking [them] to go forth from the city;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they, having gone forth out of the prison, entered into [the house of] Lydia, and having seen the brethren, they comforted them, and went forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having passed through Amphipolis, and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was the synagogue of the Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and according to the custom of Paul, he went in unto them, and for three sabbaths he was reasoning with them from the Writings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: opening and alleging, `That the Christ it behoved to suffer, and to rise again out of the dead, and that this is the Christ -- Jesus whom I proclaim to you.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of them did believe, and attached themselves to Paul and to Silas, also of the worshipping Greeks a great multitude, of the principal women also not a few.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the unbelieving Jews, having been moved with envy, and having taken to them of the loungers certain evil men, and having made a crowd, were setting the city in an uproar; having assailed also the house of Jason, they were seeking them to bring [them] to the populace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not having found them, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the city rulers, calling aloud -- `These, having put the world in commotion, are also here present,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom Jason hath received; and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying another to be king -- Jesus.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they troubled the multitude and the city rulers, hearing these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having taking security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the brethren immediately, through the night, sent forth both Paul and Silas to Berea, who having come, went to the synagogue of the Jews;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and these were more noble than those in Thessalonica, they received the word with all readiness of mind, every day examining the Writings whether those things were so;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: many, indeed, therefore, of them did believe, and of the honourable Greek women and men not a few.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Jews from Thessalonica knew that also in Berea was the word of God declared by Paul, they came thither also, agitating the multitudes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then immediately the brethren sent forth Paul, to go on as it were to the sea, but both Silas and Timothy were remaining there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those conducting Paul, brought him unto Athens, and having received a command unto Silas and Timotheus that with all speed they may come unto him, they departed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul waiting for them in Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, beholding the city wholly given to idolatry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, indeed, he was reasoning in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the worshipping persons, and in the market-place every day with those who met with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of the Epicurean and of the Stoic philosophers, were meeting together to see him, and some were saying, `What would this seed picker wish to say?' and others, `Of strange demons he doth seem to be an announcer;' because Jesus and the rising again he did proclaim to them as good news,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having also taken him, unto the Areopagus they brought [him], saying, `Are we able to know what [is] this new teaching that is spoken by thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for certain strange things thou dost bring to our ears? we wish, then, to know what these things would wish to be;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all Athenians, and the strangers sojourning, for nothing else were at leisure but to say something, and to hear some newer thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul, having stood in the midst of the Areopagus, said, `Men, Athenians, in all things I perceive you as over-religious;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for passing through and contemplating your objects of worship, I found also an erection on which had been inscribed: To God -- unknown; whom, therefore -- not knowing -- ye do worship, this One I announce to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `God, who did make the world, and all things in it, this One, of heaven and of earth being Lord, in temples made with hands doth not dwell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither by the hands of men is He served -- needing anything, He giving to all life, and breath, and all things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made also of one blood every nation of men, to dwell upon all the face of the earth -- having ordained times before appointed, and the bounds of their dwellings --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to seek the Lord, if perhaps they did feel after Him and find, -- though, indeed, He is not far from each one of us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in Him we live, and move, and are; as also certain of your poets have said: For of Him also we are offspring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Being, therefore, offspring of God, we ought not to think the Godhead to be like to gold, or silver, or stone, graving of art and device of man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the times, indeed, therefore, of the ignorance God having overlooked, doth now command all men everywhere to reform,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because He did set a day in which He is about to judge the world in righteousness, by a man whom He did ordain, having given assurance to all, having raised him out of the dead.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having heard of a rising again of the dead, some, indeed, were mocking, but others said, `We will hear thee again concerning this;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so Paul went forth from the midst of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and certain men having cleaved to him, did believe, among whom [is] also Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman, by name Damaris, and others with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these things, Paul having departed out of Athens, came to Corinth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having found a certain Jew, by name Aquilas, of Pontus by birth, lately come from Italy, and Priscilla his wife -- because of Claudius having directed all the Jews to depart out of Rome -- he came to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and because of being of the same craft, he did remain with them, and was working, for they were tent-makers as to craft;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was reasoning in the synagogue every sabbath, persuading both Jews and Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when both Silas and Timotheus came down from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the Spirit, testifying fully to the Jews Jesus the Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on their resisting and speaking evil, having shaken [his] garments, he said unto them, `Your blood [is] upon your head -- I am clean; henceforth to the nations I will go on.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having departed thence, he went to the house of a certain one, by name Justus, a worshipper of God, whose house was adjoining the synagogue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue did believe in the Lord with all his house, and many of the Corinthians hearing were believing, and they were being baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said through a vision in the night to Paul, `Be not afraid, but be speaking and thou mayest be not silent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I am with thee, and no one shall set on thee to do thee evil; because I have much people in this city;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he continued a year and six months, teaching among them the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gallio being proconsul of Achaia, the Jews made a rush with one accord upon Paul, and brought him unto the tribunal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying -- `Against the law this one doth persuade men to worship God;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul being about to open [his] mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, `If, indeed, then, it was anything unrighteous, or an act of wicked profligacy, O Jews, according to reason I had borne with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if it is a question concerning words and names, and of your law, look ye yourselves [to it], for a judge of these things I do not wish to be,'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he drave them from the tribunal;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the Greeks having taken Sosthenes, the chief man of the synagogue, were beating [him] before the tribunal, and not even for these things was Gallio caring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul having remained yet a good many days, having taken leave of the brethren, was sailing to Syria -- and with him [are] Priscilla and Aquilas -- having shorn [his] head in Cenchera, for he had a vow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he came down to Ephesus, and did leave them there, and he himself having entered into the synagogue did reason with the Jews:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they having requested [him] to remain a longer time with them, he did not consent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but took leave of them, saying, `It behoveth me by all means the coming feast to keep at Jerusalem, and again I will return unto you -- God willing.' And he sailed from Ephesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come down to Cesarea, having gone up, and having saluted the assembly, he went down to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having made some stay he went forth, going through in order the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain Jew, Apollos by name, an Alexandrian by birth, a man of eloquence, being mighty in the Writings, came to Ephesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one was instructed in the way of the Lord, and being fervent in the Spirit, was speaking and teaching exactly the things about the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this one also began to speak boldly in the synagogue, and Aquilas and Priscilla having heard of him, took him to [them], and did more exactly expound to him the way of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he being minded to go through into Achaia, the brethren wrote to the disciples, having exhorted them to receive him, who having come, did help them much who have believed through the grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for powerfully the Jews he was refuting publicly, shewing through the Writings Jesus to be the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in Apollos' being in Corinth, Paul having gone through the upper parts, came to Ephesus, and having found certain disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said unto them, `The Holy Spirit did ye receive -- having believed?' and they said unto him, `But we did not even hear whether there is any Holy Spirit;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto them, `To what, then, were ye baptized?' and they said, `To John's baptism.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul said, `John, indeed, did baptize with a baptism of reformation, saying to the people that in him who is coming after him they should believe -- that is, in the Christ -- Jesus;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they, having heard, were baptized -- to the name of the Lord Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul having laid on them [his] hands, the Holy Spirit came upon them, they were speaking also with tongues, and prophesying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the men were, as it were, twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having gone into the synagogue, he was speaking boldly for three months, reasoning and persuading the things concerning the reign of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when certain were hardened and were disbelieving, speaking evil of the way before the multitude, having departed from them, he did separate the disciples, every day reasoning in the school of a certain Tyrannus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this happened for two years so that all those dwelling in Asia did hear the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: mighty works also -- not common -- was God working through the hands of Paul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that even unto the ailing were brought from his body handkerchiefs or aprons, and the sicknesses departed from them; the evil spirits also went forth from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of the wandering exorcist Jews, took upon [them] to name over those having the evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, `We adjure you by Jesus, whom Paul doth preach;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there were certain -- seven sons of Sceva, a Jew, a chief priest -- who are doing this thing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the evil spirit, answering, said, `Jesus I know, and Paul I am acquainted with; and ye -- who are ye?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man, in whom was the evil spirit, leaping upon them, and having overcome them, prevailed against them, so that naked and wounded they did flee out of that house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this became known to all, both Jews and Greeks, who are dwelling at Ephesus, and fear fell upon them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was being magnified,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: many also of those who did believe were coming, confessing and declaring their acts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many of those who had practised the curious arts, having brought the books together, were burning [them] before all; and they reckoned together the prices of them, and found [it] five myriads of silverlings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so powerfully was the word of God increasing and prevailing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when these things were fulfilled, Paul purposed in the Spirit, having gone through Macedonia and Achaia, to go on to Jerusalem, saying -- `After my being there, it behoveth me also to see Rome;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having sent to Macedonia two of those ministering to him -- Timotheus and Erastus -- he himself stayed a time in Asia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came, at that time, not a little stir about the way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a certain one, Demetrius by name, a worker in silver, making silver sanctuaries of Artemis, was bringing to the artificers gain not a little,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom, having brought in a crowd together, and those who did work about such things, he said, `Men, ye know that by this work we have our wealth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye see and hear, that not only at Ephesus, but almost in all Asia, this Paul, having persuaded, did turn away a great multitude, saying, that they are not gods who are made by hands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not only is this department in danger for us of coming into disregard, but also, that of the great goddess Artemis the temple is to be reckoned for nothing, and also her greatness is about to be brought down, whom all Asia and the world doth worship.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they having heard, and having become full of wrath, were crying out, saying, `Great [is] the Artemis of the Ephesians!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the whole city was filled with confusion, they rushed also with one accord into the theatre, having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, Macedonians, Paul's fellow-travellers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on Paul's purposing to enter in unto the populace, the disciples were not suffering him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and certain also of the chief men of Asia, being his friends, having sent unto him, were entreating him not to venture himself into the theatre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some indeed, therefore, were calling out one thing, and some another, for the assembly was confused, and the greater part did not know for what they were come together;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and out of the multitude they put forward Alexander -- the Jews thrusting him forward -- and Alexander having beckoned with the hand, wished to make defence to the populace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having known that he is a Jew, one voice came out of all, for about two hours, crying, `Great [is] the Artemis of the Ephesians!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the public clerk having quieted the multitude, saith, `Men, Ephesians, why, who is the man that doth not know that the city of the Ephesians is a devotee of the great goddess Artemis, and of that which fell down from Zeus?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these things, then, not being to be gainsaid, it is necessary for you to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For ye brought these men, who are neither temple-robbers nor speaking evil of your goddess;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if indeed, therefore, Demetrius and the artificers with him with any one have a matter, court [days] are held, and there are proconsuls; let them accuse one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if ye seek after anything concerning other matters, in the legal assembly it shall be determined;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we are also in peril of being accused of insurrection in regard to this day, there being no occasion by which we shall be able to give an account of this concourse;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and these things having said, he dismissed the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the ceasing of the tumult, Paul having called near the disciples, and having embraced [them], went forth to go on to Macedonia;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having gone through those parts, and having exhorted them with many words, he came to Greece;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having made also three months' [stay] -- a counsel of the Jews having been against him -- being about to set forth to Syria, there came [to him] a resolution of returning through Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were accompanying him unto Asia, Sopater of Berea, and of Thessalonians Aristarchus and Secundus, and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus, and of Asiatics Tychicus and Trophimus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these, having gone before, did remain for us in Troas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we sailed, after the days of the unleavened food, from Philippi, and came unto them to Troas in five days, where we abode seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the first of the week, the disciples having been gathered together to break bread, Paul was discoursing to them, about to depart on the morrow, he was also continuing the discourse till midnight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there were many lamps in the upper chamber where they were gathered together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there was sitting a certain youth, by name Eutychus, upon the window -- being borne down by a deep sleep, Paul discoursing long -- he having sunk down from the sleep, fell down from the third story, and was lifted up dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul, having gone down, fell upon him, and having embraced [him], said, `Make no tumult, for his life is in him;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come up, and having broken bread, and having tasted, for a long time also having talked -- till daylight, so he went forth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they brought up the lad alive, and were comforted in no ordinary measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we having gone before unto the ship, did sail to Assos, thence intending to take in Paul, for so he had arranged, intending himself to go on foot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he met with us at Assos, having taken him up, we came to Mitylene,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thence having sailed, on the morrow we came over-against Chios, and the next day we arrived at Samos, and having remained in Trogyllium, on the following day we came to Miletus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Paul decided to sail past Ephesus, that there may not be to him a loss of time in Asia, for he hasted, if it were possible for him, on the day of the Pentecost to be at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Miletus, having sent to Ephesus, he called for the elders of the assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they were come unto him, he said to them, `Ye -- ye know from the first day in which I came to Asia, how, with you at all times I was;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: serving the Lord with all humility, and many tears, and temptations, that befell me in the counsels of the Jews against [me];
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how nothing I did keep back of what things are profitable, not to declare to you, and to teach you publicly, and in every house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: testifying fully both to Jews and Greeks, toward God reformation, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, lo, I -- bound in the Spirit -- go on to Jerusalem, the things that shall befall me in it not knowing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: save that the Holy Spirit in every city doth testify fully, saying, that for me bonds and tribulations remain;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I make account of none of these, neither do I count my life precious to myself, so that I finish my course with joy, and the ministration that I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify fully the good news of the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, lo, I have known that no more shall ye see my face, -- ye all among whom I did go preaching the reign of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherefore I take you to witness this day, that I [am] clear from the blood of all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I did not keep back from declaring to you all the counsel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Take heed, therefore, to yourselves, and to all the flock, among which the Holy Spirit made you overseers, to feed the assembly of God that He acquired through His own blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have known this, that there shall enter in, after my departing, grievous wolves unto you, not sparing the flock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of your own selves there shall arise men, speaking perverse things, to draw away the disciples after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Therefore, watch, remembering that three years, night and day, I did not cease with tears warning each one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, I commend you, brethren, to God, and to the word of His grace, that is able to build up, and to give you an inheritance among all those sanctified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The silver or gold or garments of no one did I covet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye yourselves know that to my necessities, and to those who were with me, minister did these hands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all things I did shew you, that, thus labouring, it behoveth [us] to partake with the ailing, to be mindful also of the words of the Lord Jesus, that he himself said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these things having said, having bowed his knees, with them all, he did pray,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there came a great weeping to all, and having fallen upon the neck of Paul, they were kissing him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sorrowing most of all for the word that he had said -- that they are about no more to see his face; and they were accompanying him to the ship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, at our sailing, having been parted from them, having run direct, we came to Coos, and the succeeding [day] to Rhodes, and thence to Patara,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having found a ship passing over to Phenicia, having gone on board, we sailed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having discovered Cyprus, and having left it on the left, we were sailing to Syria, and did land at Tyre, for there was the ship discharging the lading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having found out the disciples, we tarried there seven days, and they said to Paul, through the Spirit, not to go up to Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when it came that we completed the days, having gone forth, we went on, all bringing us on the way, with women and children, unto the outside of the city, and having bowed the knees upon the shore, we prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having embraced one another, we embarked in the ship, and they returned to their own friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we, having finished the course, from Tyre came down to Ptolemais, and having saluted the brethren, we remained one day with them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the morrow Paul and his company having gone forth, we came to Cesarea, and having entered into the house of Philip the evangelist -- who is of the seven -- we remained with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this one had four daughters, virgins, prophesying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we remaining many more days, there came down a certain one from Judea, a prophet, by name Agabus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having come unto us, and having taken up the girdle of Paul, having bound also his own hands and feet, said, `Thus saith the Holy Spirit, The man whose is this girdle -- so shall the Jews in Jerusalem bind, and they shall deliver [him] up to the hands of nations.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we heard these things, we called upon [him] -- both we, and those of that place -- not to go up to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul answered, `What do ye -- weeping, and crushing mine heart? for I, not only to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem, am ready, for the name of the Lord Jesus;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he not being persuaded, we were silent, saying, `The will of the Lord be done.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these days, having taken [our] vessels, we were going up to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there went also of the disciples from Cesarea with us, bringing with them him with whom we may lodge, a certain Mnason of Cyprus, an aged disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we having come to Jerusalem, the brethren did gladly receive us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the morrow Paul was going in with us unto James, all the elders also came,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having saluted them, he was declaring, one by one, each of the things God did among the nations through his ministration,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they having heard, were glorifying the Lord. They said also to him, `Thou seest, brother, how many myriads there are of Jews who have believed, and all are zealous of the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they are instructed concerning thee, that apostacy from Moses thou dost teach to all Jews among the nations, saying -- Not to circumcise the children, nor after the customs to walk;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what then is it? certainly the multitude it behoveth to come together, for they will hear that thou hast come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This, therefore, do that we say to thee: We have four men having a vow on themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these having taken, be purified with them, and be at expence with them, that they may shave the head, and all may know that the things of which they have been instructed concerning thee are nothing, but thou dost walk -- thyself also -- the law keeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And concerning those of the nations who have believed, we have written, having given judgment, that they observe no such thing, except to keep themselves both from idol-sacrifices, and blood, and a strangled thing, and whoredom.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul, having taken the men, on the following day, with them having purified himself, was entering into the temple, announcing the fulfilment of the days of the purification, till the offering was offered for each one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, as the seven days were about to be fully ended, the Jews from Asia having beheld him in the temple, were stirring up all the multitude, and they laid hands upon him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: crying out, `Men, Israelites, help! this is the man who, against the people, and the law, and this place, all everywhere is teaching; and further, also, Greeks he brought into the temple, and hath defiled this holy place;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they had seen before Trophimus, the Ephesian, in the city with him, whom they were supposing that Paul brought into the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the city also was moved and there was a running together of the people, and having laid hold on Paul, they were drawing him out of the temple, and immediately were the doors shut,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they seeking to kill him, a rumour came to the chief captain of the band that all Jerusalem hath been thrown into confusion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, at once, having taken soldiers and centurions, ran down upon them, and they having seen the chief captain and the soldiers, did leave off beating Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief captain, having come nigh, took him, and commanded [him] to be bound with two chains, and was inquiring who he may be, and what it is he hath been doing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and some were crying out one thing, and some another, among the multitude, and not being able to know the certainty because of the tumult, he commanded him to be carried to the castle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he came upon the steps, it happened he was borne by the soldiers, because of the violence of the multitude,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the crowd of the people was following after, crying, `Away with him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul being about to be led into the castle, saith to the chief captain, `Is it permitted to me to say anything unto thee?' and he said, `Greek dost thou know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: art not thou, then, the Egyptian who before these days made an uprising, and did lead into the desert the four thousand men of the assassins?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul said, `I, indeed, am a man, a Jew, of Tarsus of Cilicia, of no mean city a citizen; and I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he having given him leave, Paul having stood upon the stairs, did beckon with the hand to the people, and there having been a great silence, he spake unto them in the Hebrew dialect, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Men, brethren, and fathers, hear my defence now unto you;' --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they having heard that in the Hebrew dialect he was speaking to them, gave the more silence, and he saith, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `I, indeed, am a man, a Jew, having been born in Tarsus of Cilicia, and brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, having been taught according to the exactitude of a law of the fathers, being zealous of God, as all ye are to-day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this way I persecuted unto death, binding and delivering up to prisons both men and women,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as also the chief priest doth testify to me, and all the eldership; from whom also having received letters unto the brethren, to Damascus, I was going on, to bring also those there bound to Jerusalem that they might be punished,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it came to pass, in my going on and coming nigh to Damascus, about noon, suddenly out of the heaven there shone a great light round about me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fell also to the ground, and I heard a voice saying to me, Saul, Saul, why me dost thou persecute?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? and he said unto me, I am Jesus the Nazarene whom thou dost persecute --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they who are with me the light did see, and became afraid, and the voice they heard not of him who is speaking to me --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I said, What shall I do, Lord? and the Lord said unto me, Having risen, go on to Damascus, and there it shall be told thee concerning all things that have been appointed for thee to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when I did not see from the glory of that light, being led by the hand by those who are with me, I came to Damascus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a certain one, Ananias, a pious man according to the law, being testified to by all the Jews dwelling [there],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having come unto me and stood by [me], said to me, Saul, brother, look up; and I the same hour did look up to him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, The God of our fathers did choose thee beforehand to know His will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice out of his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, why tarriest thou? having risen, baptize thyself, and wash away thy sins, calling upon the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it came to pass when I returned to Jerusalem, and while I was praying in the temple, I came into a trance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I saw him saying to me, Haste and go forth in haste out of Jerusalem, because they will not receive thy testimony concerning me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I said, Lord, they -- they know that I was imprisoning and was scourging in every synagogue those believing on thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the blood of thy witness Stephen was being poured forth, I also was standing by and assenting to his death, and keeping the garments of those putting him to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto me, Go, because to nations far off I will send thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were hearing him unto this word, and they lifted up their voice, saying, `Away from the earth with such an one; for it is not fit for him to live.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they crying out and casting up their garments, and throwing dust into the air,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, saying, `By scourges let him be examined;' that he might know for what cause they were crying so against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was stretching him with the thongs, Paul said unto the centurion who was standing by, `A man, a Roman, uncondemned -- is it lawful to you to scourge;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the centurion having heard, having gone near to the chief captain, told, saying, `Take heed what thou art about to do, for this man is a Roman;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the chief captain having come near, said to him, `Tell me, art thou a Roman?' and he said, `Yes;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the chief captain answered, `I, with a great sum, did obtain this citizenship;' but Paul said, `But I have been even born [so].'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, therefore, they departed from him who are about to examine him, and the chief captain also was afraid, having learned that he is a Roman, and because he had bound him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the morrow, intending to know the certainty wherefore he is accused by the Jews, he did loose him from the bonds, and commanded the chief priests and all their sanhedrim to come, and having brought down Paul, he set [him] before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul having earnestly beheld the sanhedrim, said, `Men, brethren, I in all good conscience have lived to God unto this day;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the chief priest Ananias commanded those standing by him to smite him on the mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Paul said unto him, `God is about to smite thee, thou whitewashed wall, and thou -- thou dost sit judging me according to the law, and, violating law, dost order me to be smitten!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who stood by said, `The chief priest of God dost thou revile?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul said, `I did not know, brethren, that he is chief priest: for it hath been written, Of the ruler of thy people thou shalt not speak evil;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul having known that the one part are Sadducees, and the other Pharisees, cried out in the sanhedrim, `Men, brethren, I am a Pharisee -- son of a Pharisee -- concerning hope and rising again of dead men I am judged.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he having spoken this, there came a dissension of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees, and the crowd was divided,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Sadducees, indeed, say there is no rising again, nor messenger, nor spirit, but Pharisees confess both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came a great cry, and the scribes of the Pharisees' part having arisen, were striving, saying, `No evil do we find in this man; and if a spirit spake to him, or a messenger, we may not fight against God;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a great dissension having come, the chief captain having been afraid lest Paul may be pulled to pieces by them, commanded the soldiery, having gone down, to take him by force out of the midst of them, and to bring [him] to the castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the following night, the Lord having stood by him, said, `Take courage, Paul, for as thou didst fully testify the things concerning me at Jerusalem, so it behoveth thee also at Rome to testify.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And day having come, certain of the Jews having made a concourse, did anathematize themselves, saying neither to eat nor to drink till they may kill Paul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were more than forty who made this conspiracy by oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who having come near to the chief priests and to the elders said, `With an anathema we did anathematize ourselves -- to taste nothing till we have killed Paul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now, therefore, ye, signify ye to the chief captain, with the sanhedrim, that to-morrow he may bring him down unto you, as being about to know more exactly the things concerning him; and we, before his coming nigh, are ready to put him to death.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the son of Paul's sister having heard of the lying in wait, having gone and entered into the castle, told Paul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul having called near one of the centurions, said, `This young man lead unto the chief captain, for he hath something to tell him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He indeed, then, having taken him, brought him unto the chief captain, and saith, `The prisoner Paul, having called me near, asked [me] this young man to bring unto thee, having something to say to thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief captain having taken him by the hand, and having withdrawn by themselves, inquired, `What is that which thou hast to tell me?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said -- `The Jews agreed to request thee, that to-morrow to the sanhedrim thou mayest bring down Paul, as being about to enquire something more exactly concerning him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou, therefore, mayest thou not yield to them, for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, who did anathematize themselves -- not to eat nor to drink till they kill him, and now they are ready, waiting for the promise from thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief captain, then, indeed, let the young man go, having charged [him] to tell no one, `that these things thou didst shew unto me;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having called near a certain two of the centurions, he said, `Make ready soldiers two hundred, that they may go on unto Caesarea, and horsemen seventy, and spearmen two hundred, from the third hour of the night;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beasts also provide, that, having set Paul on, they may bring him safe unto Felix the governor;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he having written a letter after this description:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Claudius Lysias, to the most noble governor Felix, hail:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man having been taken by the Jews, and being about to be killed by them -- having come with the soldiery, I rescued him, having learned that he is a Roman;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, intending to know the cause for which they were accusing him, I brought him down to their sanhedrim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom I found accused concerning questions of their law, and having no accusation worthy of death or bonds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a plot having been intimated to me against this man -- about to be of the Jews -- at once I sent unto thee, having given command also to the accusers to say the things against him before thee; be strong.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, indeed, the soldiers according to that directed them, having taken up Paul, brought him through the night to Antipatris,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the morrow, having suffered the horsemen to go on with him, they returned to the castle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those having entered into Caesarea, and delivered the letter to the governor, did present also Paul to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the governor having read [it], and inquired of what province he is, and understood that [he is] from Cilicia;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `I will hear thee -- said he -- when thine accusers also may have come;' he also commanded him to be kept in the praetorium of Herod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after five days came down the chief priest Ananias, with the elders, and a certain orator -- Tertullus, and they made manifest to the governor [the things] against Paul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having been called, Tertullus began to accuse [him], saying, `Much peace enjoying through thee, and worthy deeds being done to this nation through thy forethought,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: always, also, and everywhere we receive it, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that I may not be further tedious to thee, I pray thee to hear us concisely in thy gentleness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for having found this man a pestilence, and moving a dissension to all the Jews through the world -- a ringleader also of the sect of the Nazarenes --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also the temple did try to profane, whom also we took, and according to our law did wish to judge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Lysias the chief captain having come near, with much violence, out of our hands did take away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having commanded his accusers to come to thee, from whom thou mayest be able, thyself having examined, to know concerning all these things of which we accuse him;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Jews also agreed, professing these things to be so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul answered -- the governor having beckoned to him to speak -- `Knowing [that] for many years thou hast been a judge to this nation, the more cheerfully the things concerning myself I do answer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou being able to know that it is not more than twelve days to me since I went up to worship in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and neither in the temple did they find me reasoning with any one, or making a dissension of the multitude, nor in the synagogues, nor in the city;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor are they able to prove against me the things concerning which they now accuse me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I confess this to thee, that, according to the way that they call a sect, so serve I the God of the fathers, believing all things that in the law and the prophets have been written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having hope toward God, which they themselves also wait for, [that] there is about to be a rising again of the dead, both of righteous and unrighteous;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in this I do exercise myself, to have a conscience void of offence toward God and men always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And after many years I came, about to do kind acts to my nation, and offerings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which certain Jews from Asia did find me purified in the temple, not with multitude, nor with tumult,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom it behoveth to be present before thee, and to accuse, if they had anything against me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or let these same say if they found any unrighteousness in me in my standing before the sanhedrim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except concerning this one voice, in which I cried, standing among them -- Concerning a rising again of the dead I am judged to-day by you.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having heard these things, Felix delayed them -- having known more exactly of the things concerning the way -- saying, `When Lysias the chief captain may come down, I will know fully the things concerning you;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having given also a direction to the centurion to keep Paul, to let [him] also have liberty, and to forbid none of his own friends to minister or to come near to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after certain days, Felix having come with Drusilla his wife, being a Jewess, he sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith toward Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he reasoning concerning righteousness, and temperance, and the judgment that is about to be, Felix, having become afraid, answered, `For the present be going, and having got time, I will call for thee;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and at the same time also hoping that money shall be given to him by Paul, that he may release him, therefore, also sending for him the oftener, he was conversing with him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two years having been fulfilled, Felix received a successor, Porcius Festus; Felix also willing to lay a favour on the Jews, left Paul bound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Festus, therefore, having come into the province, after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the chief priest and the principal men of the Jews made manifest to him [the things] against Paul, and were calling on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: asking favour against him, that he may send for him to Jerusalem, making an ambush to put him to death in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, indeed, Festus answered that Paul is kept in Caesarea, and himself is about speedily to go on thither,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Therefore those able among you -- saith he -- having come down together, if there be anything in this man -- let them accuse him;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having tarried among them more than ten days, having gone down to Caesarea, on the morrow having sat upon the tribunal, he commanded Paul to be brought;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having come, there stood round about the Jews who have come down from Jerusalem -- many and weighty charges they are bringing against Paul, which they were not able to prove,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he making defence -- `Neither in regard to the law of the Jews, nor in regard to the temple, nor in regard to Caesar -- did I commit any sin.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Festus willing to lay on the Jews a favour, answering Paul, said, `Art thou willing, to Jerusalem having gone up, there concerning these things to be judged before me?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Paul said, `At the tribunal of Caesar I am standing, where it behoveth me to be judged; to Jews I did no unrighteousness, as thou dost also very well know;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for if indeed I am unrighteous, and anything worthy of death have done, I deprecate not to die; and if there is none of the things of which these accuse me, no one is able to make a favour of me to them; to Caesar I appeal!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Festus, having communed with the council, answered, `To Caesar thou hast appealed; to Caesar thou shalt go.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain days having passed, Agrippa the king, and Bernice, came down to Caesarea saluting Festus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as they were continuing there more days, Festus submitted to the king the things concerning Paul, saying, `There is a certain man, left by Felix, a prisoner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: about whom, in my being at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews laid information, asking a decision against him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto whom I answered, that it is not a custom of Romans to make a favour of any man to die, before that he who is accused may have the accusers face to face, and may receive place of defence in regard to the charge laid against [him].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `They, therefore, having come together -- I, making no delay, on the succeeding [day] having sat upon the tribunal, did command the man to be brought,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning whom the accusers, having stood up, were bringing against [him] no accusation of the things I was thinking of,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but certain questions concerning their own religion they had against him, and concerning a certain Jesus who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I, doubting in regard to the question concerning this, said, If he would wish to go on to Jerusalem, and there to be judged concerning these things --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Paul having appealed to be kept to the hearing of Sebastus, I did command him to be kept till I might send him unto Caesar.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Agrippa said unto Festus, `I was wishing also myself to hear the man;' and he said, `To-morrow thou shalt hear him;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the morrow, therefore -- on the coming of Agrippa and Bernice with much display, and they having entered into the audience chamber, with the chief captains also, and the principal men of the city, and Festus having ordered -- Paul was brought forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Festus said, `King Agrippa, and all men who are present with us, ye see this one, about whom all the multitude of the Jews did deal with me, both in Jerusalem and here, crying out, He ought not to live any longer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I, having found him to have done nothing worthy of death, and he also himself having appealed to Sebastus, I decided to send him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning whom I have no certain thing to write to [my] lord, wherefore I brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, king Agrippa, that the examination having been made, I may have something to write;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it doth seem to me irrational, sending a prisoner, not also to signify the charges against him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Agrippa said unto Paul, `It is permitted to thee to speak for thyself;' then Paul having stretched forth the hand, was making a defence:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Concerning all things of which I am accused by Jews, king Agrippa, I have thought myself happy, being about to make a defence before thee to-day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: especially knowing thee to be acquainted with all things -- both customs and questions -- among Jews; wherefore, I beseech thee, patiently to hear me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The manner of my life then, indeed, from youth -- which from the beginning was among my nation, in Jerusalem -- know do all the Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing me before from the first, (if they may be willing to testify,) that after the most exact sect of our worship, I lived a Pharisee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now for the hope of the promise made to the fathers by God, I have stood judged,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to which our twelve tribes, intently night and day serving, do hope to come, concerning which hope I am accused, king Agrippa, by the Jews;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: why is it judged incredible with you, if God doth raise the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `I, indeed, therefore, thought with myself, that against the name of Jesus of Nazareth it behoved [me] many things to do,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which also I did in Jerusalem, and many of the saints I in prison did shut up, from the chief priests having received the authority; they also being put to death, I gave my vote against them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in every synagogue, often punishing them, I was constraining [them] to speak evil, being also exceedingly mad against them, I was also persecuting [them] even unto strange cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `In which things, also, going on to Damascus -- with authority and commission from the chief priests --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at mid-day, I saw in the way, O king, out of heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me a light -- and those going on with me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we all having fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew dialect, Saul, Saul, why me dost thou persecute? hard for thee against pricks to kick!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I said, Who art thou, Lord? and he said, I am Jesus whom thou dost persecute;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but rise, and stand upon thy feet, for for this I appeared to thee, to appoint thee an officer and a witness both of the things thou didst see, and of the things [in which] I will appear to thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: delivering thee from the people, and the nations, to whom now I send thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to open their eyes, to turn [them] from darkness to light, and [from] the authority of the Adversary unto God, for their receiving forgiveness of sins, and a lot among those having been sanctified, by faith that [is] toward me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Whereupon, king Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to those in Damascus first, and to those in Jerusalem, to all the region also of Judea, and to the nations, I was preaching to reform, and to turn back unto God, doing works worthy of reformation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of these things the Jews -- having caught me in the temple -- were endeavouring to kill [me].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Having obtained, therefore, help from God, till this day, I have stood witnessing both to small and to great, saying nothing besides the things that both the prophets and Moses spake of as about to come,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Christ is to suffer, whether first by a rising from the dead, he is about to proclaim light to the people and to the nations.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, he thus making a defence, Festus with a loud voice said, `Thou art mad, Paul; much learning doth turn thee mad;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith, `I am not mad, most noble Festus, but of truth and soberness the sayings I speak forth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the king doth know concerning these things, before whom also I speak boldly, for none of these things, I am persuaded, are hidden from him; for this thing hath not been done in a corner;
